#summary Project Tomat3007 - Arduino Uno with 433Mhz (Sender+Receiver) and Network

Hi, here is my Project:

I would like to control all my power sockets and room lights over website with 
 * a normal PC
 * a smartphone
 * something that can display websites

Important:

All must be

 * low cost
 * full removeable (if you change your flat or house)
 * plug and play (useable for normal users - without skills in developing or hardware) 
 * configurable over website (new devices / build groups of devices / build cronjobs to switch On/Off devices)

===Current situation:===
 * All Components are connected (with the jumper wires)
 * the Network-Interface is ready to get a DHCP-IP and present a static html-site. (For that i use the Ethercard Lib - [https://github.com/jcw/ethercard Link])
 * 3 power sockets are static include and can switch On/Off over Website (One by One or all together over an GroupSwitchOn)





===Components===
 * 433 Mhz Receiver ([http://www.watterott.com/de/RF-Link-2400bps-Empfaenger-434MHz Link])
 * 433 Mhz Sender ([http://www.watterott.com/de/RF-Link-Sender-434MHz Link])
 * Arduino Uno Rev. 3 ([http://www.watterott.com/de/Arduino-Uno Link])
 * ENC28J60 Network Module ([http://www.lipoly.de/index.php?main_page=product_info&products_id=200136 Link])
 * some Jumper Wires ([http://www.watterott.com/de/Low-Cost-Jumper-Wires-fuer-Breadboards-70-Stueck Link])
 * a Case for all Components
